definition[0]: to take something away from, out of, or off the place where it is
example[0]: Remove the old wallpaper and fill any holes in the walls.
example[1]: Reference books may not be removed from the library.
definition[1]: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer
example[2]: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
example[3]: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
definition[2]: to force someone out of an important position or dismiss them from a job
example[4]: Congress could remove the president from office.
definition[3]: to take off a piece of clothing
example[5]: He removed his hat and gloves.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say that someone takes clothing off rather than removes it:
example[6]: Is it OK if I take my coat off?
definition[4]: to make something no longer exist, especially something that was causing problems
example[7]: Some stains are difficult to remove with ordinary washing powder.
example[8]: All the obstacles to an agreement have now been removed.
definition[5]: to remove someone or something that you do not want. Get rid of  is much more common than remove in everyday English, but is usually only used in active sentences
example[9]: They managed to get rid of all the weeds.
example[10]: It was almost impossible to get rid of him.
definition[6]: to completely get rid of something that you do not want, especially because it is unnecessary or causing problems
example[11]: If you book online, this eliminates the need for a ticket.
example[12]: The new system will help to eliminate costly delays.
definition[7]: to completely get rid of a disease or a problem
example[13]: The disease has been eradicated from most of Europe.
example[14]: Street crime has almost been eradicated.
definition[8]: to remove something that has been written on a computer, or stored in a computer
example[15]: Do you want to delete this file?
example[16]: Press 3 to delete the messages on your answerphone.
definition[9]: to remove recorded sounds or pictures from a tape, or writing from paper
example[18]: It’s better to cross out a mistake than to try to erase it.
definition[10]: to remove a part from a film, book, speech etc
example[19]: The most violent scenes were cut.
example[20]: Parts of his original speech were cut.
definition[11]: a distance or amount by which two things are separated
example[21]: The X-ray operator works at a safe remove in a separate room.
example[22]: We need to consider the trade implications before border controls are removed.
example[23]: an injunction removing the vote from 80,000 shareholders
example[24]: The committee is recommending that the drug be removed from the market altogether.
definition[13]: to force someone to leave an important job or position
example[25]: The new directors intend to meet on Monday to remove the company’s chief executive.
example[26]: The governor was removed from office following allegations of misconduct.
